lexUnit.name: tumble.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: decline rapidly in amount or value

sentence.text: Market makers took fright , presuming someone knew something they did not , and the price tumbled 30 p.c .
For during the 1980s the world price of coal had tumbled dramatically .
SKIING holidays will be cheaper than ever this year with some prices tumbling as low as £99 for a week .
By early November , however , prices had tumbled to $1,603.50 a tonne ( for immediate delivery ) , and fell steadily as stocks rose to a record 315,600 tonnes in December .
And with glass volumes down , prices have tumbled by 20pc in the three main markets Britain , Germany and America .
HOUSE prices tumbled again last month , according to the latest survey by Nationwide Building Society published yesterday .
Having posted shining results for years , Compaq recently warned that its second-quarter sales will be 15% down on 1990's figure , and that profits will tumble by close to 80% .
While group profits tumbled from £38½m to £21m last year — after £6m of exceptional closure costs — both the other divisions turned in better figures .
Pre-tax profits tumbled to £44.8m from £70m in 1991 as the group had to pay exceptional redundancy and related costs of £9.2m .
ARCOLECTRIC 'S shares tumbled 20p to 113p on a fall in half year pre-tax profits from £320,000 to £128,000 .
But , with turnover down 31 p.c. , the North American side tumbled from a £5½m profit to a £1.83m loss .
For Blue Circle , cement volumes tumbled by 17 p.c. in Britain last year , and yet group profits fell by ` only " 36 p.c. and it could maintain its dividends without too much strain .
He is trying to reschedule his £1.2 billion of debts after the net worth of his Heron group tumbled from £585m to just £100m last year .
The Earls Court Boat Show last month saw the launching of a GPS set called the Pronav for £1,495 , including VAT , and other sets have begun to tumble in price .
Inflation is supposed to tumble to 17% a month .
